intro: Mantisalca cabezudoi, commonly known as the Cabezudo's mantisalca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to purple. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
